tuv.seg: A Personal Insolvency Arrangement (PIA) is one of 3 debt resolution mechanisms introduced by the Personal Insolvency Act 2012 for people who cannot afford to pay their personal debts

Tá an Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (SDP) ar cheann de thrí mheicníocht réitigh fiachais a tugadh isteach faoin Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta 2012 do dhaoine nach bhfuil in ann íoc as a bhfiachas pearsanta
These mechanisms offer different solutions to people in different situations
Cuireann na socruithe seo réitigh dhifriúla ar fáil do dhaoine i gcásanna éagsúla
The Personal Insolvency Arrangement applies to the agreed settlement and/or restructuring of secured debts up to a total of €3 million (as well as unsecured debts) over a period of 6 years
Baineann an Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta le réiteach comhaontaithe agus/nó athstruchtúrú fiachais faoi urrús a mhéid le €3 milliún (mar aon le fiachas gan urrús) thar thréimhse 6 bliana
The cap of €3 million can be increased by agreement with your secured creditors and the limit of 6 years can increase to 7 years in some situations
Féadtar an uasteorainn €3 milliún a mhéadú tar éis comhaontú a bhaint amach le do chreidiúnaithe faoi urrús agus féadtar an uasteorainn 6 bliana a mhéadú go dtí 7 mbliana i gcásanna áirithe
This document describes how to qualify for a PIA and how the PIA process works
Déantar cur síos sa cháipéis seo ar conas cáiliú do SDP agus ar conas a oibríonn an próiseas SDP
The Insolvency Service of Ireland (ISI) has published detailed information about PIAs, including possible scenarios, FAQs and a guidebook
D’fhoilsigh Seirbhís Dócmhainneachta na hÉireann (SDÉ) faisnéis shonrach faoi SDPanna, lena n-áirítear cásanna féideartha, ceisteanna coitianta, agus treoirleabhar
It also provides extra information on PIAs, including a quick guide (pdf), on its website backontrack.ie, aimed at people who are struggling with debt
Tugann an SDÉ breis eolas breise ar SDPanna agus treoir ghearr (pdf) ar an suíomh backontrack.ie, atá dírithe ar dhaoine a bhfuil fadhbanna fiachais acu
You can read a general overview of personal insolvency options here
Féadfaidh tú foramharc ar an gcóras nua um dhócmhainneacht phearsanta a léamh anseo
Provision for court review
Soláthar nua d’athbhreithniú cúirte
A series of measures announced on 13 May 2015 included changes to the personal insolvency system
I measc na mbeart nua a fógraíodh an 13 Bealtaine 2015, tá athruithe ar an gcóras um dhócmhainneacht phearsanta, a bhfuil gach ceann díobh i bhfeidhm anois
All of these changes are now in effect. They include court review where a mortgage lender rejects the borrower’s proposal for a PIA
Áirítear leo athbhreithniú cúirte, sa chás go ndiúltaíonn iasachtóir morgáiste togra um dhócmhainneacht phearsanta an iasachtóra

This review option only applies to mortgages that were in arrears on 1 January 2015, or to mortgages that were in arrears before that and where the borrower entered into an alternative repayment arrangement

Ní bhaineann an rogha athbhreithnithe seo ach le morgáistí a raibh riaráistí acu an 1 Eanáir 2015, nó a raibh riaráistí acu roimhe sin agus inar iontráil an t-iasachtóir isteach i socrú malartach aisíocaíochta
The court will review the application, including any objections made by creditors
Athbhreithneoidh an chúirt an t-iarratas, aon aighneachtaí a dhéanann creidiúnaithe san áireamh
Subject to meeting certain criteria set out in the legislation, the judge may impose the original PIA proposal on the creditor(s)
A fhad go gcomhlíontar critéir áirithe a leagtar amach sa reachtaíocht, féadfaidh an breitheamh an buntogra a bhaineann leis an Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta

Personal Insolvency Arrangements provide for the agreed settlement and/or restructuring of debts in the case of people who have secured debts up to a total of €3 million (as well as any unsecured debts) and have no prospect of being able to pay off their debts in the next 5 years

Déanann Socruithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta soláthar do réiteach comhaontaithe agus/nó athstruchtúrú fiachais i gcás daoine a bhfuil fiachas faoi urrús acu a mhéid le €3 milliún (mar aon le haon fhiachas gan urrús) agus nach measann siad go mbeidh siad in ann a bhfiachas a íoc sna 5 bliana amach romhainn
You can only avail of a PIA once in your lifetime
Ní féidir leat SDP a fháil ach uair amháin i do shaol

You cannot get a PIA if you are involved in one of the other debt resolution processes introduced by the Act, or in the bankruptcy process, or if you have completed one of these processes within the last 5 years (3 years for a Debt Relief Notice)

Ní féidir leat SDP a fháil má tá baint agat i gceann amháin de na próisis eile réitigh a tugadh isteach faoin Acht, nó sa phróiseas féimheachta, nó má chríochnaigh tú ceann de na próisis seo le 5 bliana anuas (nó le trí bliana anuas i gcás Fógra um Fhaoiseamh Fiachais)
Under the original legislation, you could only get a PIA by agreement of a specified majority of your secured and unsecured creditors – see Main elements of a PIA below
Faoin mbunreachtaíocht, ní fhéadfá SDP a fháil ach trí chomhaontú a dhéanamh ar thromlach sonraithe do chuid creidiúnaithe urraithe agus neamhurraithe – féach Príomhghnéithe SDP thíos
However, as noted above, you can now seek a court review if a mortgage lender rejects your personal insolvency proposal
Faoi mar a thugtar faoi deara thuas, áfach, féadfaidh tú athbhreithniú cúirte a lorg má dhiúltaíonn iasachtóir morgáiste do thogra um dhócmhainneacht phearsanta
See ‘Creditors’ meeting’ below for more detail
Féach ‘Cruinniú na gcreidiúnaithe’ thíos chun teacht ar bhreis sonraí
You must be domiciled in the State, or else have been living or had a place of business in the State within the year before you make your application
Ní mór go mbeadh sainchónaí ort sa Stát, nó go raibh cónaí ort nó áit gnó agat sa Stát sa bhliain sula ndéanann tú d’iarratas
You will only qualify for a PIA if you owe debt to at least one secured creditor holding security over Irish property or assets (secured debt)
Ní cháileoidh tú do SDP ach má tá fiachas le híoc agat le creidiúnaí amháin faoi urrús, ar a laghad, ag a bhfuil urrús ar mhaoin nó sócmhainní Éireannacha (fiachas faoi urrús)
If you have no secured debts you should apply for a Debt Settlement Arrangement or a Debt Relief Notice
Mura bhfuil aon fhiachas faoi urrús agat, ba cheart duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar Shocrú um Réiteach Fiachais nó ar Fhógra um Fhaoiseamh Fiachais
In general, the total of your debt to your secured creditors must add up to less than €3 million
Go ginearálta, níor mhór nach mbeadh níos mó ná €3 milliún le híoc agat, ar an iomlán, mar fhiachas le do chuid creidiúnaithe faoi urrús
However, this cap can be waived if all of your secured creditors agree in writing
Ar a shon sin, féadtar an uasteorainn seo a tharscaoileadh má chomhaontaíonn gach duine de do chuid creidiúnaithe faoi urrús i scríbhinn

At least three-quarters (75%) of your debts must have built up at least 6 months before you apply for a PIA – in other words, you can’t apply for a PIA if any more than 25% of your debts were incurred in the last 6 months

Ní mór gur cruthaíodh ar a laghad trí cheathrú (75%) de do chuid fiachais ar a laghad 6 mhí sula ndéanann tú iarratas ar SDP – i bhfriotal eile, ní féidir leat iarratas a dhéanamh ar SDP má tabhaíodh breis agus 25% de do chuid fiachais le 6 mhí anuas
Secured and unsecured debts
Fiachas faoi urrús agus gan urrús
A Personal Insolvency Arrangement is only for people who have secured debts (though it can include some unsecured debts – see below) so it is important to know whether your debts are secured or not

Ta an Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta dírithe ar dhaoine ag a bhfuil fiachas faoi urrús (cé gur féidir roinnt fiachais gan urrús a áireamh – féach thíos), mar sin, is tábhachtach fios a bheith agat cibé acu an bhfuil d'fhiachas faoi urrús nó nach bhfuil
A secured debt is a loan on which property or goods are available as security against non-payment
Iasacht atá i bhfiachas faoi urrús ar a bhfuil fáil ar réadmhaoin nó earraí mar urrús i leith neamhíocaíochta
Mortgages and car loans are the most common secured loans
Is iad morgáistí agus iasachtaí gluaisteáin na hiasachtaí is coitianta d’iasachtaí faoi urrús
Some examples of unsecured debts are: utility bill arrears (gas, electricity etc.); credit card debt; bank overdrafts; credit union loans
Roinnt samplaí d’fhiachas gan urrús iad: riaráistí bille fóntais (gás, leictreachas, etc.); fiachas cárta creidmheasa; rótharraingtí bainc; iasachtaí comhar creidmheasa
However, if they are rolled up into your mortgage, they become secured loans
Má tá siad in éineacht le do mhorgáiste, áfach, déantar iasachtaí faoi urrús díobh
Excluded and excludable debts
Fiachas eisiata agus in-eisiata
The Personal Insolvency Act 2012 specifies certain types of debt that cannot be written off by the debt settlement procedures that it introduced, which include the Personal Insolvency Arrangement

Sonraítear san Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta 2012 roinnt saghsanna d’fhiachas nach féidir a dhíscríobh leis na nósanna imeachta réitigh a thug an tAcht isteach, ina measc an Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
These are called excluded debts
Tugtar fiachas eisiata orthu seo
The Act specifies certain other types of debt to be excludable from a PIA
Sonraítear san Acht roinnt saghsanna eile d’fhiachas atá in-eisiata ó SDP
This means that they can be covered by the PIA if the creditor is asked and agrees to let them be included – in which case they become permitted debts – debts that the creditor permits to be covered

Ciallaíonn seo nach féidir iad a chuimsiú ag an SDP ach amháin má iarrtar ar an gcreidiúnaí agus má aontaíonn sé/sí le hiad a áireamh – agus sa chás sin, déantar fiachas ceadaithe astu – arb ionann sin agus fiachas a cheadaíonn an creidiúnaí a chuimsiú
If the creditor is asked and does not respond, the creditor is also deemed to have consented to the debts being included
Má iarrtar ar an gcreidiúnaí agus mura dtugann sé/sí freagra, measfar gur thug an creidiúnaí toiliú go gcuirfear san áireamh an fiachas
Most types of excludable debts are those owed to the State
Is fiachas in-eisiata an chuid is mó den fhiachas atá le híoc leis an Stát
The types of debt that are excluded and cannot be covered by a PIA are:
Is iad na saghsanna fiachais a eisítear agus nach féidir le SDP a chumhdach:
• Debts under family law orders, such as maintenance orders for spouses and children
• Fiachas faoi orduithe dlí teaghlaigh, ar nós orduithe cothabhála do chéilí agus leanaí
• Debts due under court awards for personal injury or death
• Fiachas atá le híoc faoi dhámhachtain chúirte mar gheall ar ghortú pearsanta nó bás
• Debts arising from a loan (or forbearance of a loan) obtained through fraud or similar wrongdoing
• Fiachas a eascraíonn ó iasacht (nó staonadh iasachta) a fuarthas mar gheall ar chalaois nó éagóir dá samhail sin
• Debts arising under court orders made under the Proceeds of Crime Acts or fines imposed by the courts for criminal offences
• Fiachas a eascraíonn faoi orduithe cúirte a rinneadh faoi na hAchtanna um Fháltais ó Choireacht nó fíneálacha a ghearrann na cúirteanna mar gheall ar chionta coiriúla
The types of debt that are excludable and may be covered if the creditor agrees are:
Is iad na saghsanna fiachais atá in-eisiata agus is féidir a chumhdach le comhaontú an chreidiúnaí:
• Taxes, duties, charges or levies owed to the State, such as income tax, the Local Property Tax, VAT, capital taxes
• Cáin, dleachtanna, muirir nó tobhaigh atá le híoc leis an Stát, ar nós cáin ioncaim, an Mhuirir Theaghlaigh, na Cánach Maoine Áitiúla, CBL, cáin chaipitiúil
• Service charges owed to local authorities
• Muirir sheirbhíse atá le híoc le húdaráis áitiúla
• Money owed under the Nursing Homes Support Scheme (in respect of a loan advanced by the HSE to a nursing home resident to cover the amount due from the principal private residence)

• Airgead atá le híoc faoin Scéim Tacaíochta do Thithe Altranais (i dtaca le hiasacht a réamhíoc FSS le cónaitheoir i dteach altranais chun íoc as an méid atá le híoc ón bpríomháit chónaithe phríobháideach)
• Money owed to the Department of Social Protection, such as overpayments
• Airgead atá le híoc leis an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí, ar nós ró-íocaíochtaí
• Debts due to owners’ management companies in respect of annual service charges or contributions due for multi-unit developments (this is the only non-State debt in this category)

• Fiachas atá le híoc le cuideachtaí bainistíochta úinéirí maidir le muirir nó le ranníocaíochtaí bliantúla seirbhíse atá le híoc le haghaidh forbairtí ilaonad (seo an t-aon fhiachas neamhStáit sa chatagóir seo)
Mortgage arrears on your home
Riaráistí morgáiste ar do theach

In general, you must declare that you have co-operated with your mortgage lender for at least 6 months in respect of your principal private residence (your home) in accordance with the Central Bank’s Code of Conduct on Mortgage Arrears; and that, in spite of this co-operation, you have been unable to agree an alternative repayment arrangement or the lender has confirmed in writing that it does not wish to enter into such an arrangement

Go ginearálta, ní mór duit a dhearbhú gur chomhoibrigh tú le d’iasachtóir morgáiste ar feadh sé mhí, ar a laghad, maidir le do phríomháit chónaithe (do theach) i gcomhréir le Cód Iompair maidir le Riaráistí Morgáiste an Bhainc Cheannais; agus, in ainneoin an chomhoibrithe seo, nach raibh tú in ann socrú aisíocaíochta eile a chomhaontú nó gur dhearbhaigh an t-iasachtóir i scríbhinn nach mian leis nó léi iontráil sa socrú sin

This rule does not apply if your Personal Insolvency Practitioner (PIP) – see below – declares that you would still not be likely to be solvent in 5 years if you accepted such an alternative repayment arrangement

Níl an riail seo i gceist má dhearbhaíonn do Chleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (CDP) – féach thíos – nach dócha go fóill go mbeifeá sócmhainneach i gceann 5 bliana dá nglacfá leis an socrú aisíocaíochta eile sin
Further information for people facing mortgage arrears is available on keepingyourhome.ie
Tá fáil ar thuilleadh faisnéise do dhaoine a bhfuil riaráistí morgáiste i ndán dóibh ar keepingyourhome.ie
You must make your proposal for a PIA through a Personal Insolvency Practitioner (PIP) – see The PIA process below
Ní mór duit do thogra le haghaidh SDP a dhéanamh trí Chleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (CDP) – féach An Próiseas SDP thíos

Once you have agreed the terms of the PIA proposal with your PIP, you then need approval from a creditors’ meeting or, failing that, your proposal may be imposed on your creditors after a court review

A luaithe a dhéanann tú comhaontú ar théarmaí an togra SDP le do Chleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (CDP), is gá duit faomhadh a fháil ó chruinniú creidiúnaithe nó, murar féidir sin a dhéanamh, d’fhéadfaí do thogra a fhorchur ar do chreidiúnaithe i ndiaidh athbhreithniú cúirte
See ‘Creditors’meeting’ below’ for more detail
Féach ‘Cruinniú na gcreidiúnaithe’ thíos chun teacht ar bhreis sonraí
A PIA may involve you making regular payments of agreed amounts to your Personal Insolvency Practitioner, who then distributes them to your creditors according to the terms of the PIA

Mar chuid de SDP, b’fhéidir go mbeadh ort íocaíochtaí rialta a dhéanamh de shuimeanna lenar comhaontaíodh le do Chleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta, a dhéanfaidh iad a dháileadh ar do chreidiúnaithe i gcomhréir le téarmaí an SDP
Your creditors may not take any action against you to enforce the debt during the lifetime of the PIA
Tharlódh nach nglacfadh do chreidiúnaithe aon ghníomh i do leith chun an fiachas a fhorfheidhmiú le linn shaolré an SDP
If you keep to the terms of the PIA, the rest of your debt to your unsecured creditors will be discharged
Má chloíonn tú le téarmaí an SDP, déanfar an chuid eile de d’fhiachas le do chuid creidiúnaithe gan urrús a dhíscaoileadh
However, when the PIA ends, you will still be liable for the outstanding amount of your secured debts, such as your mortgage
Ar a shon sin, nuair a thiocfaidh deireadh leis an SDP, áfach, beidh tú fós faoi dhliteanas íoc as an tsuim nár íocadh de do chuid fiachais, ar nós do mhorgáiste
The PIA has been designated as an insolvency proceeding which can benefit from cross-border recognition
Tá an SDP ainmnithe mar imeacht dócmhainneachta ar féidir leis leas a bhaint as aitheantas trasteorann

This means that a debtor availing of a PIA will gain the same protection against creditors in most other EU countries that they receive in Ireland, subject to and in accordance with the Regulation on Insolvency Proceedings (EC) No 1346/2000 (pdf), as updated by Regulation (EU) No.663/2014 (pdf)

Fágann sé sin go mbeidh an chosaint chéanna ar chreidiúnaithe i bhformhór na dtíortha eile den AE is atá aige/aici in Éirinn ag féichiúnaí atá ag baint leas as SDP, faoi réir agus de réir an Rialacháin (CE) Uimh. 1346/2000 maidir le hImeachtaí Dócmhainneachta (pdf), arna nuashonrú ag Rialachán (AE) Uimh. 663/2014 (pdf)
Read more in this press release
Léigh tuilleadh sa phreaseisiúint seo
There are certain elements that the PIA must contain:
Tá roinnt gnéithe ann nach mór don SDP a chuimsiú:
• The maximum duration of the agreement must be 6 years but this may be extended by up to 1 year in circumstances as specified in the terms of the arrangement
• Ní mór go mbeidh fad uasta an chomhaontaithe sé bliana, ach is féidir seo a shíneadh le bliain amháin ar a mhéid faoi na cúinsí a shonraítear i dtéarmaí an chomhaontaithe
• The PIA must clearly distinguish between secured debts and unsecured debts and must make provision for the manner in which the security held by the creditor is to be treated
• Ní mór go ndéanfaidh an SDP idirdhealú soiléir idir fiachas faoi urrús agus fiachas gan urrús agus soláthar a dhéanamh don bhealach a chaitear leis an urrús a choimeádann an creidiúnaí
Unless your secured creditors agree otherwise, they may get the full value of their security or the full amount of the debt if the property is sold
Mura gcomhaontaíonn do chreidiúnaithe faoi urrús ar a mhalairt, féadfaidh said luach iomlán a n-urrúis a fháil, nó suim iomlán an fhiachais má dhíoltar an mhaoin
If they agree to accept less than the full value of the security, there is a clawback if the security is sold for greater than the value estimated at the time of the arrangement
Má chomhaontaíonn siad chun glacadh le luach níos lú ná luach iomlán an urrúis, beidh aisghlámadh i gceist má dhíoltar an t-urrús ar luach a sháraíonn an luach measta tráth an tsocraithe
• If you keep to the terms of the agreement your remaining debts to your unsecured creditors will be discharged
• Má chloíonn tú le téarmaí an chomhaontaithe, déanfar an chuid eile de d’fhiachas le do chuid creidiúnaithe gan urrús a dhíscaoileadh

• You remain liable for certain debts unless the proposed arrangement explicitly provides for a compromise agreement and the creditor has agreed in writing to accept this – see ‘Excluded and excludable debts’ above

• Beidh tú fós faoi dhliteanas íoc as roinnt fiachais mura bhforálann an socrú beartaithe go sonrach do chomhaontú comhgréitigh agus murar chomhaontaigh an creidiúnaí i scríbhinn go nglacfar leis seo – féach ‘Fiachas eisiata agus in-eisiata’ thuas
• The PIA cannot release you from fines or other monetary penalties arising from criminal offences
• Ní féidir leis an SDP thú a scaoileadh ó fhíneálacha nó ó phionóis eile airgid a eascraíonn ó chionta coiriúla
• It cannot require you to sell any assets that are reasonably necessary for your employment or business unless you agree to such a sale
• Ní féidir leis ceangal ort aon sócmhainní a dhíol a bhfuil údar réasúnta leo ar mhaithe le d’fhostaíocht nó le do ghnólacht mura gcomhaontaíonn tú ar an díol sin
• You must be left with enough income to maintain a reasonable standard of living for yourself and your dependants
• Níor mhór go bhfágfar leat dóthain ioncaim le caighdeán réasúnta maireachtála a choimeád duit féin agus do do chuid cleithiúnaithe
• It must not require you to dispose of your principal private residence (your home) or to cease to occupy it unless specific conditions are met – see ‘Secured creditors’ below

• Níor cheart go gceanglódh sé ort fáil réidh le do phríomháit chónaithe (do theach) nó chun deireadh a chur le cónaí ann mura gcomhlíontar coinníollacha sonracha – féach ‘Creidiúnaithe faoi urrús’ thíos
• It must outline how your debts will be treated in the event of your death or mental incapacity
• Ní mór go dtabharfar breac-chuntas ann ar conas a chaithfear le d'fhiachas i gcás do bháis nó éagumas meabhrach

• It must provide that your circumstances be reviewed by the Personal Insolvency Practitioner at regular intervals (not more than 12 months) during the currency of the PIA; this review will involve the preparation of a new Prescribed Financial Statement that must be sent to all the creditors

• Níor mhór go bhforálfadh sé go ndéanfadh an Cleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta athbhreithniú ar do chúinsí ag eatraimh rialta (tráth nach faide ná 12 mhí) le linn shaolré an SDP; is éard a bheidh i gceist leis an athbhreithniú seo, Ráiteas nua Forordaithe Airgeadais a réiteach nach mór a sheoladh go dtí na creidiúnaithe go léir
• It must make provision for the Personal Insolvency Practitioner’s costs
• Níor mhór go ndéanfar soláthar ann do chostais an Chleachtóra um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta

Ongoing pension income receivable by you or an entitlement to a pension lump sum or income in accordance with the tax code will be treated as an asset or, as applicable, income for the purposes of a PIA

Caithfear le hioncam leanúnach ó phinsean atá infhaighte agat nó teidlíocht i leith cnapshuim phinsin nó ioncaim i gcomhréir leis an gcód cánach mar shócmhainn nó, de réir mar is infheidhme, mar ioncam ar mhaithe le cuspóirí SDP
The terms of the PIA may provide for payment of some or all of that pension/lump sum or income to creditors during the PIA period
D’fhéadfaí a fhoráil i dtéarmaí an SDP go n-íocfar cuid nó an chuid go léir den phinsean/chnapshuim nó den ioncam sin le creidiúnaithe le linn thréimhse an SDP
Your pension fund will be excluded from any PIA if it is a relevant pension arrangement for the purposes of the Act
Déanfar do chiste pinsin a eisiamh ó aon SDP más socrú iomchuí pinsin é chun críocha an Achta
Approved Retirement Funds (ARFs) do not fall into this category and may be included in a PIA
Ní thagann Cistí Faofa Scoir (ARFanna) faoi chuimsiú na catagóire seo agus féadtar iad a chur san áireamh sa SDP
There will be an onus on you to be transparent in relation to all historical pension contributions and the PIP will review these
Beidh dliteanas ort bheith trédhearcach maidir le gach ranníocaíocht stairiúil phinsin agus déanfaidh an CDP athbhreithniú orthu siúd

If a creditor or your PIP considers that you have made excessive pension contributions in the 3 years before applying for a PIA, an application can be made to the court to recover these contributions for distribution to your creditors

Má mheasann creidiúnaí nó do CDP go ndearna tú an iomad ranníocaíochtaí pinsin sna 3 bliana sula ndearna tú iarratas ar SDP, féadtar iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gcúirt chun na ranníocaíochtaí seo a aisghabháil lena leithdháileadh chuig do chuid creidiúnaithe
While the PIA is in effect, you may not get credit for any amount over €650 without informing the lender that you have a PIA
Fad a bhíonn an SDP i bhfeidhm, féadfaidh tú sochar a fháil d’aon suim os cionn €650 gan an t-iasachtóir a chur ar an eolas go bhfuil SDP agat
You may not sell or deal in property above a certain value, except in accordance with the terms of the PIA
Ní féidir leat maoin os cionn luach áirithe a dhíol nó a thrádáil, seachas i gcomhréir le téarmaí an SDP
However, no such restriction is placed on your spouse or civil partner
Ní leagtar a shamhail de shrian ar do chéile nó do pháirtnéir sibhialta, áfach
You must make your proposal for a PIA through a Personal Insolvency Practitioner (PIP)
Ní mór duit do thogra le haghaidh SDP a dhéanamh trí Chleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (CDP)
This is a professional who is authorised by the Insolvency Service of Ireland (ISI) and will act on your behalf throughout the Personal Insolvency Arrangement
Seo duine gairmiúil a fuair údarú ó Sheirbhís Dócmhainneachta na hÉireann (SDÉ) agus a ghníomhóidh ar do shon ó thús go deireadh an tSocraithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
The ISI has developed standard protocols for use by PIPs when making straightforward proposals to creditors for a PIA or a Debt Settlement Arrangement
Tá prótacal caighdeánach forbartha ag an ISI lena úsáid ag PIPanna agus tograí furasta á ndéanamh acu do chreidiúnaithe le haghaidh SDP nó Shocrú um Réiteach Fiachais

You must disclose all details of your financial affairs to the PIP, who will then advise you whether or not you meet the conditions for a PIA, the consequences, any alternative options, and the fees that you may have to pay

Ní mór duit gach sonra faoi do chuid gnóthaí airgeadais a nochtadh don CDP, a chuirfidh comhairle ansin ort cibé acu an gcomhlíonann nó nach gcomhlíonann tú na coinníollacha le haghaidh SDP, na hiarmhairtí, aon roghanna eile, agus na táillí a d’fhéadfadh bheith ort a íoc
You must act in good faith and co-operate fully with the process
Ní mór duit gníomhú le hintinn mhaith agus comhoibriú go hiomlán leis an bpróiseas
The PIP will help you complete a Prescribed Financial Statement as part of your application, giving full and honest information about your financial circumstances
Cabhróidh an CDP leat Ráiteas Forordaithe Airgeadais a chomhlánú mar chuid de d’iarratas, ina dtugtar faisnéis iomlán agus ionraic faoi do chuid cúinsí airgeadais

You must also make a declaration that you have been unable to agree an alternative repayment arrangement with your creditor(s) or that your creditor(s) have confirmed in writing that they are unwilling to enter into an alternative repayment arrangement in respect of your principal private residence

Ina theannta sin, ní mór duit dearbhú a dhéanamh nach raibh tú in ann socrú eile aisíocaíochta a chomhaontú le do chreidiúnaí/chreidiúnaithe nó gur dhearbhaigh do chreidiúnaí/chreidiúnaithe i scríbhinn nach bhfuil siad toilteanach iontráil i socrú aisíocaíochta eile leat maidir le do phríomháit chónaithe
See ‘Mortgage arrears on your home’ above for specific rules about mortgage debt
Féach ‘Riaráistí morgáiste ar do theach’ thuas chun teacht ar rialacha sonracha faoi fhiachas morgáiste
You will have to give your written consent to enable:
Beidh ort do thoiliú i scríbhinn a thabhairt chun an méid a leanas a chur ar bun:
• The PIP to disclose your personal data to the ISI
• Go nochtfaidh an CDP do shonraí pearsanta do SDÉ
• The ISI to process your application
• Go bpróiseálfaidh SDÉ d’iarratas
• The ISI to make any necessary enquiries about you and
• Go ndéanfaidh an SDÉ aon fhiosrúchán riachtanach fút, agus
• The ISI to disclose your personal data to the creditors concerned, as required
• Go nochtfaidh SDÉ do shonraí pearsanta do na creidiúnaithe go léir lena mbaineann, de réir mar a theastaíonn
In general, you must act in good faith and co-operate fully with the process
Go ginearálta, ní mór duit gníomhú le hintinn mhaith agus comhoibriú go hiomlán leis an bpróiseas
The ISI has published detailed information on fees
D’fhoilsigh an ISI faisnéis mhionsonraithe faoi tháillí
It has waived its own fees for the 3 debt solutions, originally until the end of 2015, and has extended this waiver to the end of 2017 (pdf)
Rinne sé a tháillí féin a tharscaoileadh i dtaobh na 3 rogha fiachais, go deireadh 2015 i dtosach, agus shín sé an tarscaoileadh seo go dtí deireadh 2017 (pdf)

In general, a fee of €500 was payable to the ISI for the issue of a protective certificate – described below. However, in the case of ‘interlocking’ PIAs, which is where two individuals have joint and independent debts on their own, only one fee had to be paid
Ní ann d’aon scála socraithe táillí do PIPanna, ach ceanglaítear orthu a dtáillí agus a gcostais ghaolmhara a shonrú sula gceaptar iad chun gníomhú thar do cheann
There is no set scale of fees for PIPs, but they are required to specify their charges and associated costs clearly before being appointed to act on your behalf
I gcás SDPanna ‘comhshnaidhmthe’, áfach, áit a mbíonn comhfhiachais agus fiachais neamhspleácha ag beirt daoine aonair leo féin, ní raibh ach táille amháin le híoc
The Personal Insolvency Practitioner sends your application to the ISI
Seolann an Cleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta d’iarratas chuig an tSeirbhís Dócmhainneachta

The ISI checks that all the details are in order and, if so, issues a certificate to that effect and forwards all to the relevant court (the Circuit Court in cases up to €2.5 million and the High Court in larger cases)

Seiceálfaidh SDÉ go bhfuil na sonraí uile in ord agus, má tá siad, eiseoidh siad deimhniú ina leith sin mar aon leis an deimhniú a sheoladh ar aghaidh chuig an gcúirt chuí (an Chúirt Chuarda i gcásanna a mhéid le €2.5 milliún agus an Ard-Chúirt i gcásanna níos mó)
The court reviews the documentation and, if all is in order, issues a protective certificate
Déanfaidh an chúirt athbhreithniú ar an gcáipéisíocht go léir, agus, má tá gach aon rud in ord, eiseoidh siad deimhniú cosanta
The ISI records the details of the protective certificate on its Register of Protective Certificates
Cuirfidh an tSeirbhís Dócmhainneachta sonraí an deimhnithe cosanta i dtaifead ar a Clár Deimhnithe Cosanta
The PIP then notifies each of your creditors of the existence of the protective certificate and your intention to make a proposal for a PIA
Ansin tugann an Cleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta fógra do gach duine de do chuid creidiúnaithe gurb ann don deimhniú agus go bhfuil sé beartaithe agat togra le haghaidh SDP a dhéanamh
The protective certificate will give you 70 days during which your creditors may not:
Tabharfaidh an deimhniú cosanta 70 lá duit, tráth nach féidir le do chreidiúnaithe an méid a leanas a dhéanamh:
• Start or continue legal proceedings in respect of the debt
• Tús a chur le himeachtaí dlí maidir leis an bhfiachas nó leanúint leis na himeachtaí siúd
• Take or continue any steps to enforce a judgment or contact you about the debt unless you agree to this
• Dul i mbun aon bhirt chun breithiúnas a fhorfheidhmiú nó leanúint leis na bearta siúd nó teagmháil a dhéanamh leat faoin bhfiachas mura gcomhaontaíonn tú leis seo
• Start or continue bankruptcy proceedings against you
• Tús a chur le himeachtaí féimheachta i do leith nó leanúint leis na himeachtaí siúd
The court may extend the period of the protective certificate by a further 40 days if it is satisfied that:
Féadfaidh an chúirt tréimhse an deimhnithe cosanta a shíneadh le 40 lá breise má tá siad sásta faoin méid a leanas:
• You and the PIP have acted in good faith and with reasonable expedition, and
• Ghníomhaigh tú féin agus an Cleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta le hintinn mhaith agus le heachtra réasúnta, agus
• It is likely that, if the extension is granted, a proposal for a PIA will be made that is likely to be accepted by the creditors and successfully completed by you
• Gur dócha, má dheonaítear an síneadh, go ndéanfar togra do SDP ar dócha go nglacfaidh na creidiúnaithe leis agus go gcomhlíonfaidh tú go rathúil é
A creditor may apply to the court for an order directing that the protective certificate not apply to him or her
Féadfaidh creidiúnaí iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gcúirt a ordaíonn nach mbainfidh an deimhniú cosanta leis nó léi

The court will grant this order only if satisfied that failing to give it would cause irreparable loss to the creditor that would not otherwise occur and that no other creditor to whom notice of the protective certificate has been given would be unfairly prejudiced

Ní dheonóidh an chúirt an t-ordú seo ach amháin má tá siad sásta go mbeadh an creidiúnaí thíos le caillteanas dóréitithe dá bharr, nach dtarlódh murach sin, agus nach ndéanfar difear éagórach d’aon chreidiúnaí eile ar tugadh fógra dóibh faoin deimhniú cosanta
Once the protective certificate has been granted, your PIP must invite the relevant creditors to make proposals about the manner in which the debts might be dealt with as part of a PIA
A luaithe a dheonaítear an deimhniú cosanta, ní mór do do CDP iarraidh ar na creidiúnaithe cuí tograí a dhéanamh faoin mbealach inar féidir déileáil le fiachas mar chuid de SDP
The creditors must be given your Prescribed Financial Statement
Ní mór do Ráiteas Forordaithe Airgeadais a thabhairt do na creidiúnaithe
The PIA must provide for the way in which security held by your creditors is treated
Ní mór don SDP foráil a dhéanamh don bhealach ina gcaitear le hurrús atá á choimeád ag do chreidiúnaithe
Unless they agree otherwise, they may get the full value of their security or the full amount that you owe them if the security (such as a second property) is sold
Mura gcomhaontaíonn do chreidiúnaithe ar a mhalairt, féadfaidh said luach iomlán a n-urrúis a fháil, nó an tsuim iomlán atá le híoc agat leo (ar nós an dara maoin) má dhíoltar an t-urrús
When formulating the proposal for a PIA, the PIP will ensure, as far as is reasonably practicable, that you are not required to sell or move out of your principal private residence (your home)
Nuair a bhíonn an togra don SDP á chur i dtoll a chéile, cinnteoidh an CDP, a fhad agus is indéanta go réasúnta, nach gá duit bogadh amach ó do phríomháit chónaithe phríobháideach (do theach)
If you wish to move out, or if the PIP believes that the running costs of staying in your home are disproportionately large, the PIA may provide for you to move out of it
Más mian leat bogadh amach, nó má chreideann an CDP go bhfuil na costais reatha atá i gceist agus tú ag fanacht i do theach as cuimse, féadfaidh an SDP a fhoráil go mbogann tú amach uaidh
When you have consented to the proposal for a PIA that has been formulated by your PIP, the PIP must call a creditors’ meeting
Nuair a thug tú toiliú don togra do SDP a chruthaigh do CDP, ní mór don CDP cruinniú creidiúnaithe a thionól
If there is only one creditor, he or she may write to the PIP indicating agreement or rejection
Mura bhfuil ach creidiúnaí amháin ann, féadfaidh é/í scríobh chuig an CDP agus comhaontú nó diúltú a chur in iúl
The creditors vote on whether or not to accept the proposed arrangement
Caitheann na creidiúnaithe vóta ar cibé acu an nglacfaidh nó nach nglacfaidh siad leis an socrú beartaithe
Each vote is proportional to the amount of debt owed to that creditor
Tá gach vóta i gcomhréir leis an méid fiachais atá le híoc leis an gcreidiúnaí sin
Creditors representing 65% or more of the value of the total debt – both secured and unsecured – must vote in favour, for the arrangement to be accepted
Ní mór do chreidiúnaithe a léiríonn 65% nó níos mó de luach an fhiachais iomláin – idir fhiachas faoi urrús agus gan urrús – vótáil i bhfabhar, go nglacfar an socrú
In addition, over 50% of your secured creditors and 50% of unsecured creditors must vote in favour
Anuas air sin, ní mór go gcaithfidh breis agus 50% de do chuid creidiúnaithe faoi urrús agus 50% de do chuid creidiúnaithe gan urrús ina fhabhar
Under the original legislation, if the creditors reject the proposal, the protective certificate ceases to have effect and the PIA process comes to an end
Faoin reachtaíocht bhunúil, má dhiúltaíonn na creidiúnaithe an togra, cuirtear deireadh le héifeacht an deimhnithe cosanta agus cuirtear deireadh leis an bpróiseas SDP
However, the Personal Insolvency (Amendment) Act 2015 now provides for court review where a mortgage lender rejects the borrower’s personal insolvency proposal
Foráiltear anois san Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (Leasú), 2015 d’athbhreithniú cúirte sa chás go ndiúltaíonn iasachtóir morgáiste togra um dhócmhainneacht phearsanta an iasachtóra
Read more detail about this process in the ISI’s press release (pdf)
Is féidir leat níos mó sonraí a léamh faoin bpróiseas seo i bpreaseisiúint an ISI (pdf)

If the proposal is accepted, the PIP must inform the Insolvency Service and tell creditors of their right to object to the relevant court - (the Circuit Court in cases up to €2.5 million and the High Court in larger cases)

Má ghlactar leis an togra, ní mór don CDP an tSeirbhís Dócmhainneachta a chur ar an eolas agus an ceart atá ag na creidiúnaithe a chur in iúl chun cur i gcoinne na cúirte cuí – (an Chúirt Chuarda i gcásanna a mhéid le €2.5 milliún agus an Ard-Chúirt i gcásanna níos mó)
The Insolvency Service notifies the court
Tugann an tSeirbhís Dócmhainneachta fógra don chúirt
If there is any objection, the protective certificate remains in place until the matter is decided
Má bhíonn aon aighneacht ann, fanann an deimhniú cosanta i bhfeidhm go dtí go ndéantar cinneadh ar an ábhar
The grounds on which an objection to the coming into effect of the Personal Insolvency Arrangement may be made are limited and include the following:
Tá na bunúis ar ar féidir aighneacht a dhéanamh i leith teacht i bhfeidhm Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta, faoi theorainn agus áirítear leo an méid a leanas:
• You arranged your affairs in the previous 2 years primarily with a view to becoming eligible for a Debt Settlement Arrangement or a Personal Insolvency Arrangement
• Shocraigh tú féin do chuid gnóthaí sna 2 bhliain roimhe seo, féachaint le bheith incháilithe do Shocrú um Réiteach Fiachais nó Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
• The procedural requirements were not followed
• Níor leanadh na ceanglais nós imeachta
• A material inaccuracy or omission exists in your Prescribed Financial Statement that causes a material detriment to the creditor
• Is ann do mhíchruinneas nó d’easnamh i do Ráiteas Forordaithe Airgeadais a bhíonn ina chúis le dochar ábhartha a dhéanamh don chreidiúnaí
• You did not meet the requirements when the arrangement was proposed
• Níor chomhlíon tú na ceanglais nuair a beartaíodh an socrú
• The arrangement unfairly prejudices the interests of a creditor
• Déanann an socrú difear éagórach do leas an chreidiúnaí
• You have committed an offence under the Personal Insolvency legislation
• Rinne tú cion faoin reachtaíocht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
• You have entered into a transaction at an undervalue or given a preference to a person in the previous three years that has materially contributed to your inability to pay your debts
• D’iontráil tú in idirbheart ar saorluach nó roghnaigh tú duine sna trí bliana roimhe seo a chuir go hábhartha leis na deacrachtaí atá agat chun íoc as do chuid fiachais
Issue of a Personal Insolvency Arrangement
Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta a eisiúint
If there is no objection or an objection is not upheld, the court approves the Personal Insolvency Arrangement if satisfied that all the conditions have been met
Murab ann d’aon aighneacht nó mura seastar le haon aighneacht, faomhann an chúirt an Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta, má tá siad sásta gur comhlíonadh na coinníollacha go léir
The Insolvency Service records the PIA in its Register of Personal Insolvency Arrangements and it comes into effect
Déanann an tSeirbhís Dócmhainneachta an SDP a chur i dtaifead ina Clár Socruithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta agus tagann sé i bhfeidhm
Deferring Local Property Tax
Cáin Mhaoine Áitiúil a Chur Siar
Once you have entered into a Personal Insolvency Arrangement, you can apply for a deferral of Local Property Tax (LPT) while the PIA is in place
A luaithe a d’iontráil tú i Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta, is féidir leat iarratas a dhéanamh ar Cháin Mhaoine Áitiúil (CMÁ) a chur siar fad a bhíonn an SDP i bhfeidhm
Read more on revenue.ie
Is féidir leat níos mó a léamh ar revenue.ie
Varying a Personal Insolvency Arrangement
Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta a éagsúlú
Personal Insolvency Arrangements may be varied – the procedures are similar to those for setting up the arrangement
Féadtar Socruithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta a éagsúlú – is cosúil na nósanna imeachta leo siúd chun an socrú a chur ar bun
A creditor or a PIP may apply to the court at any time during the Personal Insolvency Arrangement to have it ended
Féadfaidh creidiúnaí nó CDP iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gcúirt aon tráth le linn an tSocraithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta go gcuirfear deireadh leis
The grounds for such an application are limited and include the following:
Beidh na bunúis le haghaidh iarratais den sórt sin teoranta agus áireofar leo an méid a leanas:
• Your Prescribed Financial Statement has a material inaccuracy or omission that causes a material detriment to the creditor
• Is ann do mhíchruinneas nó d’easnamh ábhartha i do Ráiteas Forordaithe Airgeadais atá ina chúis le dochar ábhartha a dhéanamh don chreidiúnaí
• You did not meet the requirements when you started the process
• Níor chomhlíon tú na ceanglais nuair a thosaigh an próiseas
• You did not comply with the terms of the Personal Insolvency Arrangement
• Níor chloí tú le téarmaí an tSocraithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
• You have committed an offence under the personal insolvency legislation since the arrangement came into effect
• Rinne tú cion faoin reachtaíocht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta ó tháinig an socrú i bhfeidhm
• You are in arrears with your payments for a period of not less than 3 months
• Tá riaráistí cruthaithe agat le d’íocaíochtaí ar feadh tréimhse nach lú ná 3 mhí
The full list of grounds is in Section 122 of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
Tá an liosta iomlán bunús le fáil in Alt 122 den Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta 2012
If you are in arrears with your payments for more than 6 months, the PIA will be deemed to have failed
Má tá riaráistí cruthaithe agat le d’íocaíochtaí ar feadh tréimhse níos mó ná 6 mhí, measfar gur theip ar an SDP
This will be recorded in the Register of Personal Insolvency Arrangements
Cuirfear seo i dtaifead sa Chlár Socruithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
Ending of a Personal Insolvency Arrangement
Deireadh a chur le Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta

If the arrangement ends other than by successful completion, you will become fully liable for all specified debts, inclusive of arrears, charges and interest that have accrued during the PIA period, less any payments made by you during that time, unless the terms of the PIA specify, or the court has ordered, otherwise

Má chuirtear deireadh leis an socrú, seachas deireadh tar éis críochnú rathúil, beidh tú go hiomlán faoi dhliteanas íoc as an bhfiachas iomlán a shonraítear, mar aon le riaráistí, muirir agus ús a cruthaíodh le linn na tréimhse SDP, lúide aon íocaíochtaí a rinne tú i dturas an ama sin, murar ordaigh téarmaí an SDP, an chúirt a mhalairt go sonrach
If the arrangement is successfully completed, you are discharged from the unsecured debts covered by the arrangement
Má chríochnaítear an socrú go rathúil, díscaoiltear thú ón bhfiachas gan urrús atá cumhdaithe ag an socrú
You will not be discharged from the secured debts, except where this was explicitly provided for in the PIA
Ní dhíscaoilfear thú ón bhfiachas gan urrús, seachas sa chás go ndearnadh foráil shonrach dó seo sa SDP
The successful completion is recorded on the Register of Personal Insolvency Arrangements
Cuirtear an críochnú rathúil i dtaifead sa Chlár Socruithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
Your application for a Personal Insolvency Arrangement must be made through a Personal Insolvency Practitioner (PIP)
Ní mór d’iarratas ar Shocrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta a dhéanamh trí Chleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
You can choose one from the Register of Personal Insolvency Practitioners that is published by the ISI
Is féidir CDP a roghnú ón gClár CDPanna a d'fhoilsigh an ISI

Further information is available from the ISI’s helpline 0761 06 4200 (Monday to Friday, 9 am to 6 pm) and from its main website isi.gov.ie, as well as its website backontrack.ie for people who are struggling with debt

Is féidir tuilleadh eolais a fháil ó líne chabhrach an ISI 0761 06 4200 (Luan go hAoine, 9 rn go 6 in), ón láithreán isi.gov.ie agus ón láithrean backontrack.ie, atá dírithe ar dhaoine a bhfuil fadhbanna fiachais acu
